activities.name: Flores en la Ría Festival
activities.description: Experience Bilbao in bloom during this spring celebration featuring floral installations, garden exhibitions, and landscaping displays along the Nervión River.
activities.seasonal_notes: Late March through April transforms Bilbao's riverfront walkways and bridges with spectacular floral displays celebrating spring's arrival.
activities.booking_tips: No booking required; self-guided walking maps available at tourist information centers. Weekday visits offer a more relaxed experience.

activities.name: Basque Derby: Athletic Club vs. Real Sociedad
activities.description: Experience the passion of Basque football at San Mamés Stadium during this historic rivalry between Bilbao's Athletic Club and San Sebastian's Real Sociedad.
activities.seasonal_notes: Spring fixtures in La Liga season (typically March-May) offer more pleasant weather for match attendance than winter games.
activities.booking_tips: Purchase tickets through Athletic Club's official website well in advance; matches often sell out. International ID required for ticket collection.

activities.name: Semana Santa (Holy Week) Processions
activities.description: Witness Bilbao's traditional Easter processions featuring religious brotherhoods carrying elaborate floats through the Old Town and city center.
activities.seasonal_notes: Dates vary each year (March-April) with processions throughout Holy Week, particularly impressive on Holy Thursday and Good Friday.
activities.booking_tips: No booking required; arrive early to secure viewing spots along the main procession routes in Casco Viejo and Gran Vía.

activities.name: Mount Artxanda Bloom
activities.description: Take the historic funicular railway to Mount Artxanda to experience panoramic views of Bilbao surrounded by spring blossoms and greenery.
activities.seasonal_notes: April and May offer lush green landscapes and clear days with optimal visibility of the surrounding mountains and cityscape.
activities.booking_tips: No booking required for the funicular, which runs every 15 minutes. Visit on weekdays to avoid weekend crowds; bring a picnic to enjoy at the summit.

activities.name: Basque Spring Cuisine Tour
activities.description: Discover seasonal Basque delicacies featuring spring ingredients like white asparagus, anchovies, and spring lamb through restaurant special menus.
activities.seasonal_notes: April through June showcases the finest spring produce in Basque cuisine, with many restaurants offering special seasonal tasting menus.
activities.booking_tips: Reserve tables at acclaimed restaurants like Mina or Zarate to experience their spring menus. Lunch reservations are easier to secure than dinner.

activities.name: Bilbao BBK Running Festival
activities.description: Join or watch this popular running event with various race distances through Bilbao's most scenic neighborhoods and iconic landmarks.
activities.price_range: Budget to participate, Free to watch
activities.seasonal_notes: Typically held in May, the event offers comfortable spring temperatures ideal for running across Bilbao's distinctive city landscape.
activities.booking_tips: Register online months in advance to participate in races. Spectators can watch for free along the route, with prime viewing spots near the Guggenheim and City Hall.

activities.name: Txakoli Wine Season
activities.description: Experience the release of new vintage Txakoli, the Basque Country's distinctive slightly sparkling white wine, with special tastings and pairings.
activities.seasonal_notes: Spring marks the release of new Txakoli vintages, celebrated throughout Bilbao's wine bars and surrounding wine-producing areas like Getaria.
activities.booking_tips: Reserve spots for guided Txakoli tastings through Bilbao tourism office or join a day trip to nearby Txakoli producers in Getaria or Bakio.

activities.name: Bilbao Architecture Week
activities.description: Explore Bilbao's renowned architectural heritage through special tours, exhibitions, and open buildings during this annual celebration.
activities.seasonal_notes: Held in May, this event celebrates Bilbao's transformation through architecture with unique access to significant buildings and special exhibitions.
activities.booking_tips: Check the official website for program details; popular tours of iconic buildings like the Guggenheim behind-the-scenes should be booked well in advance.

activities.name: Day Trip to Urdaibai Biosphere Reserve
activities.description: Explore this UNESCO-protected coastal ecosystem during spring migration season when thousands of birds pass through its marshes and forests.
activities.seasonal_notes: April and May are ideal for birdwatching as migratory species pass through, while spring flora transforms the landscape with vibrant colors.
activities.booking_tips: Take the direct train from Bilbao-Atxuri station to Busturia-Itsasbegi for the Urdaibai Bird Center. Guided tours should be booked online in advance.

activities.name: Aste Nagusia (Great Week) Festival
activities.description: Experience Bilbao's largest festival featuring nine days of concerts, traditional sports, street performances, fireworks, and bullfights throughout the city.
activities.seasonal_notes: Held in late August, this massive celebration brings the entire city to life with festivities led by the symbolic figure Marijaia.
activities.booking_tips: No booking needed for most events; accommodation should be reserved months in advance as the city fills completely during this period.

activities.name: Bilbao BBK Live Music Festival
activities.description: Attend one of Spain's premier music festivals featuring international headliners across multiple stages on Mount Cobetas overlooking the city.
activities.seasonal_notes: Held in early July, this three-day festival combines world-class music with stunning hillside views of Bilbao and camping options.
activities.booking_tips: Purchase tickets months in advance; festival and camping passes sell out quickly. Shuttle buses run from central Bilbao to the venue.

activities.name: Beaches of Getxo and Sopelana
activities.description: Escape the city heat at nearby coastal beaches accessible by metro, offering swimming, sunbathing, and renowned surfing conditions.
activities.seasonal_notes: June through September offers warm temperatures ideal for beach activities, with August being the busiest month as locals vacation.
activities.booking_tips: No booking required; take Metro Line 1 to Algorta or Sopelana. Visit on weekdays to avoid weekend crowds.

activities.name: Kayaking on the Nervión River
activities.description: Paddle through the heart of Bilbao on guided kayak tours offering unique perspectives of the city's iconic architecture from the water.
activities.seasonal_notes: Summer provides calm water conditions and warm temperatures ideal for exploring Bilbao's rejuvenated riverfront by water.
activities.booking_tips: Book tours through Bilboats or similar operators at least several days in advance, especially for weekend slots.

activities.name: Open-Air Cinema at Abandoibarra
activities.description: Enjoy films under the stars with the illuminated Guggenheim and Nervión River as backdrop at this summer cinema series.
activities.seasonal_notes: Screenings run through July and August, with films beginning after sunset around 10:00 PM in typical Spanish fashion.
activities.booking_tips: Purchase tickets online or arrive early; bring something to sit on and light layers as evenings can cool down even in summer.

activities.name: Getxo International Jazz Festival
activities.description: Experience world-class jazz performances in the seaside district of Getxo, combining music with beautiful coastal scenery just outside Bilbao.
activities.seasonal_notes: Held in early July, this prestigious festival features performances in both indoor venues and outdoor stages near the historic port.
activities.booking_tips: Purchase tickets online in advance; easily accessible from Bilbao via metro to Algorta station.

activities.name: Basque Coast Hiking Tour
activities.description: Hike sections of the dramatic coastal path between Bilbao and San Sebastian, featuring stunning cliffs, fishing villages, and beaches.
activities.seasonal_notes: Summer offers the most reliable weather for coastal hiking, though early morning starts are recommended to avoid midday heat.
activities.booking_tips: No booking required for self-guided hiking; public transportation connects various sections of the trail. The Uribe Kosta route from Plentzia to Sopelana is particularly accessible from Bilbao.

activities.name: San Mamés Stadium Tour
activities.description: Visit Athletic Club's legendary stadium, known as 'The Cathedral of Football,' through guided tours explaining the club's unique Basque-only player policy and history.
activities.seasonal_notes: Summer offers the chance to visit when no matches are scheduled, providing full access to areas normally restricted during the season.
activities.booking_tips: Book tours online through Athletic Club's official website; English-language tours available on specific days.

activities.name: Vizcaya Bridge Experience
activities.description: Visit the world's oldest transporter bridge, a UNESCO site connecting Portugalete and Getxo, with the option to ride the gondola or walk across the high panoramic walkway.
activities.seasonal_notes: Summer provides clear views from the upper walkway, with pleasant temperatures for enjoying the coastal areas on either side of the bridge.
activities.booking_tips: No booking required; regular gondola crossings operate throughout the day. The upper walkway requires a separate ticket and may close in windy conditions.

activities.name: BIME Live Music Festival and Conference
activities.description: Experience this dual music festival and industry conference featuring cutting-edge artists and music business innovators at the BEC venue.
activities.best_time: Evening for concerts, Day for conference
activities.seasonal_notes: Held in late October/early November, this event brings international music industry focus to Bilbao with both public concerts and professional conferences.
activities.booking_tips: Purchase festival tickets online well in advance; industry conference passes available separately for music professionals.

activities.name: Rioja Alavesa Wine Harvest
activities.description: Experience the autumn grape harvest in the nearby Rioja Alavesa wine region with special winery tours, tastings, and harvest festivals.
activities.seasonal_notes: September and October mark the grape harvest season, when wineries come alive with activity and the countryside displays autumn colors.
activities.booking_tips: Book guided tours from Bilbao with transportation included, or rent a car to explore independently. Major wineries like Ysios and Marqués de Riscal require advance reservations.

activities.name: Bilbao Mushroom Foraging
activities.description: Join guided mushroom hunting excursions in the forests surrounding Bilbao during peak season for this important Basque culinary tradition.
activities.seasonal_notes: October and November offer ideal conditions for mushroom growth after autumn rains, with expert guides helping identify edible varieties.
activities.booking_tips: Book through specialized tour operators like Bilbao Food Safari or local mycological associations; tours fill quickly during peak mushroom season.

activities.name: International Documentary Film Festival (Zinebi)
activities.description: Attend this prestigious documentary and short film festival featuring screenings, director talks, and workshops throughout Bilbao.
activities.seasonal_notes: Held in November, this festival brings international documentary filmmakers to Bilbao during the atmospheric autumn season.
activities.booking_tips: Purchase tickets online once the program is released; festival passes offer the best value for multiple screenings.

activities.name: Pintxo Championship Season
activities.description: Sample award-winning and competition pintxos as Bilbao's best bars compete in various autumn championships, creating innovative special offerings.
activities.seasonal_notes: Various pintxo competitions run through autumn, inspiring bars to create their most creative and delicious offerings to win prestigious titles.
activities.booking_tips: No reservations needed for most pintxo bars; follow local food blogs or tourist office announcements to track which bars are competing and what their special competition pintxos are.

activities.name: Guggenheim Autumn Exhibition
activities.description: Experience the Guggenheim's major autumn exhibition, typically featuring international contemporary artists in specially curated shows.
activities.seasonal_notes: Autumn brings significant new exhibitions after the summer tourist season, often presenting the museum's most ambitious curatorial projects.
activities.booking_tips: Purchase timed-entry tickets online to avoid queues; visit on weekday mornings for a more contemplative experience.

activities.name: Txotx Cider Season Opening
activities.description: Experience the beginning of Basque cider season with special events at sagardotegis (cider houses) featuring traditional cider-pouring rituals.
activities.seasonal_notes: The cider season traditionally begins in late autumn, when new cider starts to mature and sagardotegis prepare for the official January opening.
activities.booking_tips: Reserve spots for special pre-season events through local cider houses or join organized tours from Bilbao to nearby cider-producing regions.

activities.name: El Arenal Market Autumn Harvest
activities.description: Explore Bilbao's historic market as it showcases autumn's bounty including wild mushrooms, game meats, and seasonal produce from the Basque countryside.
activities.seasonal_notes: October through December brings the richest seasonal products to the market, with specialized vendors offering foraged and hunted autumn delicacies.
activities.booking_tips: No booking required; visit early on weekday mornings for the freshest selection and to watch locals selecting seasonal specialties.

activities.name: Basque Mountain Hiking
activities.description: Experience the spectacular autumn colors in the mountains surrounding Bilbao, with hiking routes for all levels featuring dramatic landscapes.
activities.seasonal_notes: October provides ideal hiking conditions with comfortable temperatures, clear visibility, and forests transformed with fall colors.
activities.booking_tips: Join guided hikes through mountain clubs or tourist operators for the best experience; popular routes include Gorbea Natural Park and Urkiola Natural Park.

activities.name: Santo Tomás Festival
activities.description: Experience Bilbao's traditional pre-Christmas market featuring Basque rural products, traditional txistorra sausage, and cultural demonstrations.
activities.seasonal_notes: Held on December 21st, this festival transforms Plaza Nueva and the Old Town into a celebration of Basque rural traditions and winter foods.
activities.booking_tips: No booking required; arrive early to avoid the largest crowds. Bring cash for food purchases from traditional farmhouse stalls.

activities.name: Txotx Cider Season
activities.description: Participate in the traditional Basque cider house experience, where new season's cider is poured directly from large barrels accompanied by a special menu.
activities.seasonal_notes: The official season begins mid-January and runs through spring, with special opening ceremonies at major cider houses in the region.
activities.booking_tips: Reserve well in advance for popular sagardotegis (cider houses); organized tours from Bilbao with transportation simplify the experience.

activities.name: Bilbao Arte Contemporary Art Winter Program
activities.description: Explore cutting-edge exhibitions by emerging artists at this dynamic art center housed in a converted warehouse in Bilbao's creative district.
activities.seasonal_notes: Winter features thought-provoking exhibitions by artists-in-residence and the winter program typically offers the most experimental work.
activities.booking_tips: No booking required; check their website for special events, artist talks, and workshop opportunities during exhibitions.

activities.name: Skiing Day Trip to Formigal
activities.description: Take a day trip to the nearby Pyrenees for skiing and snowboarding at one of Spain's premier winter resorts, accessible from Bilbao.
activities.seasonal_notes: December through March offers reliable snow conditions, with January and February typically providing the best skiing weather.
activities.booking_tips: Book organized day trips including transportation and lift tickets, or rent a car for more flexibility. Equipment rental available at the resort.

activities.name: Three Kings Parade (Cabalgata de Reyes)
activities.description: Experience Spain's most important Christmas tradition as the Three Kings parade through Bilbao distributing candies and bringing gifts to children.
activities.seasonal_notes: Held on January 5th, the eve of Epiphany, this spectacular parade features elaborate floats and costumes across central Bilbao.
activities.booking_tips: No booking required; arrive early for good viewing spots along Gran Vía and bring bags for children to collect thrown candies.

activities.name: Bilbao Winter Gastronomy
activities.description: Experience traditional Basque winter cuisine featuring hearty stews, bean dishes, and salt cod preparations at Bilbao's finest restaurants.
activities.seasonal_notes: January and February feature specialized winter menus highlighting warming dishes like alubias de Tolosa (black bean stew) and bacalao al pil-pil (cod in garlic sauce).
activities.booking_tips: Reserve traditional restaurants like Restaurante Askora or Bascook to experience authentic winter Basque cuisine at its best. Lunch reservations are generally easier to secure than dinner.

activities.name: Athletic Club Football Match
activities.description: Experience the passion of Basque football at San Mamés Stadium, known as 'The Cathedral,' during the heart of La Liga season.
activities.seasonal_notes: Winter matches (December-February) often feature the most important fixtures of the season in comfortable conditions inside the state-of-the-art stadium.
activities.booking_tips: Purchase tickets through Athletic Club's official website weeks in advance; international ID required for ticket collection. The atmosphere for derby matches against Real Sociedad or local rivals is particularly special.

activities.name: Carnival (Carnaval) in Bilbao
activities.description: Experience Bilbao's version of carnival featuring costumes, parades, music, and the ceremonial burning of the carnival figure 'El Momo'.
activities.seasonal_notes: Held in February or early March (date varies by liturgical calendar), bringing color and festivities to the city during the winter season.
activities.booking_tips: No booking required for public celebrations; check the city's cultural agenda for specific events and parade routes.

activities.name: FIG Bilbao - International Printmaking Festival
activities.description: Explore this unique art fair dedicated to fine art printmaking, featuring galleries, master printers, and artists from around the world.
activities.seasonal_notes: Typically held in November/December, this specialized art event showcases the rich tradition of printmaking in an intimate setting.
activities.booking_tips: Purchase tickets online or at the venue; check the program for demonstrations, workshops, and artist talks that require separate registration.
